title: Same Tree
description: Given the roots of two binary trees p and q, write a function to check if they are the same or not. Two binary trees are considered the same if they are structurally identical, and the nodes have the same value.
constraints: The number of nodes in both trees is in the range [0, 100].

brute-force.name: Recursive
brute-force.description: Check if current nodes match and recurse.

steps.instruction: Define the function is_same_tree that takes p and q.
Base case: if both are None, they are same.
steps.placeholderCode:
if not p and not q:
        return True
steps.hint: Return True if both trees are empty.
steps.solutionCode:
if not p and not q:
        return True

steps.instruction: Base case: if one is None or values differ, they are not same.
steps.placeholderCode:
if not p or not q or p.val != q.val:
        return False
steps.hint:
Return False if one is empty or values don't match.

Example:
P=1, Q=1. Match.
P.left=2, Q.left=null. Mismatch! Return False.
steps.solutionCode:
if not p or not q or p.val != q.val:
        return False

steps.instruction: Recursively check left and right subtrees.
steps.placeholderCode: return is_same_tree(p.left, q.left) and is_same_tree(p.right, q.right)
steps.hint: Check if left subtrees and right subtrees are the same.
steps.solutionCode: return is_same_tree(p.left, q.left) and is_same_tree(p.right, q.right)

optimal.name: Recursive
optimal.description: Same as brute force, O(n) is optimal.
